block.p: As a Spanish-speaking non-Hispanic, please count me in as a fan of ''Xica,'' the Brazilian telenovela, accidentally discovered while switching channels [''Brazil Builds Bigger and Better Telenovelas'' by Larry Rohter, Aug. 27]. Believe me, this is not an ordinary soap opera.

Watching ''Xica'' is like rereading Gilberto Freyre's monumental ''The Masters and the Slaves'' -- a glimpse of Brazilian history. It has it all: the imperial years of the monarchy, the decadent aristocracy, the plantation owner, the slaves, sex, mortal sins, damnation and redemption, thus exposing the very soul of Brazil.
